section.para: The ngx_http_sub_module module is a filter that modifies a response by replacing one specified string by another.
This module is not built by default, it should be enabled with the --with-http_sub_module configuration parameter.

directive.name: sub_filter
directive.para: Sets a string to replace and a replacement string. The string to replace is matched ignoring the case. The replacement string can contain variables.

directive.name: sub_filter_last_modified
directive.para: Allows preserving the Last-Modified header field from the original response during replacement to facilitate response caching.
By default, the header field is removed as contents of the response are modified during processing.

directive.name: sub_filter_once
directive.para: Indicates whether to look for a string to replace once or several times.

directive.name: sub_filter_types
directive.para: Enables string replacement in responses with the specified MIME types in addition to “text/html”. The special value “*” matches any MIME type (0.8.29).
